clinical_study.brief_title: Melatonin for Cerebral Palsy Children's Sleep and Health
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Melatonin Supplementation on Sleep and Health of Children With Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: The present study was prospective uncontrolled, single-armed and un-blinded study. Held in the Pediatric neurology clinic, Children's hospital l, Faculty of Medicine, Ain Shams University from June 2016 to June 2018 of 24 months timeframe. All cerebral palsy (CP) patients following up in Pediatric neurology clinic aged between 2 and 12 years. Melatonin given for 3 months. Anthropmetric measures, gastroeintestinal symptoms, Children's sleep habits questionnaire (CSHQ) Arabic version, polysomnography, Chalfont epilepsy severity score, and EEG were done at enrollment and after the 3-months.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, cohort study conducted in Pediatric Neurology Clinic, Children's Hospital, Faculty of Medicine, Ain Shams University. Forty children with sCP with sleep and seizure problems, aged 2-12 years were enrolled. The children received crushed Melatonin 3-mg tablets daily, 30-minutes before bedtime for 3-months. Children's sleep habits questionnaire (CSHQ) Arabic version, polysomnography, Chalfont epilepsy severity score, and EEG were done at enrollment and after the 3-months. The ethical approval number is (FMASU MD 202/2016).

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in total Children's sleep habits questionnaire score
primary_outcome.description: response to melatonin as decrease in total sleep score
response to melatonin in improvement of growth

intervention.description: The children received crushed Melatonin 3-mg tablets daily, 30-minutes before bedtime for 3-months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All cerebral palsy children with sleep problem and seizure disorder,
- aged 2 - 12 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- any auditory and peripheral visual impairments
